Race.SpecificTitle: Alderman at Large -- Town of Oberlin
Council Member -- District 2, City of Oakdale
Council Member -- District 3, City of Oakdale
PW School District -- Local Option - Term Limits
Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within Allen Parish School District:
Shall the number of terms of office that any member of the school board may serve be limited to three consecutive four-year terms?"

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Police Jury -- 4 mills - PJ - 10 yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Millage)

Summary:  10 year, 4 mills property tax for improving, maintaining and supporting the Allen Parish Courthouse and Jail.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Allen, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a special tax of four (4) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $308,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of improving, maintaining and supporting the Courthouse and Jail of the Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road District No. 5 -- 5.30 tax continuation - PJ - 10 yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road District No. 5 Proposition
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 5.30 tax continuation for the purpose of constructing, operating and maintaining Parish roads and bridges within the District.
Race.FullText: Shall Road District No. 5 of the Parish of Allen, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to continue to levy a five and thirty hundredths (5.30) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $140,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of constructing, operating and maintaining Parish roads and bridges within the District, said millage to represent an eighteen hundredths of a mill (.18) increase over the 5.12 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2012 pursuant to an election held on November 5, 2002?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Dist. No. 6 -- $400,000 Bonds - BOC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 6 Proposition

Summary:  Authority to issue $400,000, 15 year general obligation bonds for acquiring, constructing and improving fire protection facilities and equipment, including fire trucks for said District, to be payable from ad valorem taxes.
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 6 of the Parish of Allen, State of Louisiana (the "District") incur debt and issue in one or more series from time to time not exceeding Four Hundred Thousand Dollars ($400,000) of general obligation bonds to run not exceeding fifteen (15) years from the date thereof, with interest at a rate or rates not exceeding eight percentum (8%) per annum, to be sold at par, premium or discount, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing and improving fire protection facilities and equipment, including fire trucks, for said District, title to which shall be in the public, which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and statutory authority supplemental thereto, with an estimated 3.85 mills (an estimated $47,043.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) to be levied in the first year of issue to pay said Bonds?
